details.description: You may need to tell DVLA if you have acoustic neuroma
details.body:
You may need to tell DVLA if you have an acoustic neuroma.

You can be fined up to £1,000 if you don’t tell DVLA about a medical condition that affects your driving. If you’re involved in an accident, you may be prosecuted.

Car or motorcycle licence

You only need to tell DVLA if you suffer from disabling giddiness.

Fill in forms B1 and DIZ1 and send them to DVLA. The address is on the form.

Download ‘B1 - Confidential medical information’ (PDF, 318KB)

Download ‘DIZ1 - Confidential medical information’ (PDF, 196KB)

Bus, coach or lorry licence

You must tell DVLA. Fill in forms B1 and DIZ1V and send them to DVLA. The address is on the form.

Download ‘B1 - Confidential medical information’ (PDF, 318KB)

Download ‘DIZ1V - Confidential medical information’ (PDF, 260KB)
